SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

rmp
Class JxtaReliableMcastService

java.lang.Object
  rmp.JxtaReliableMcastService
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class JxtaReliableMcastService
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

Title: Reliable Multicast Pipes

Description:
This class is the manager of the channels that a node-peer can create or can join to. It is responsible for the formation of the multicast tree but not for the creation of the links between parent - child nodes. It only sends and receives the required information to/through the dedicated private multicast socket and stores that info in a channel object. It also decides if a peer is either a provider or just a listener of the created channel. Be careful to surround the public methods with try-catch because they throw RMSException

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2005

Company: JXTA ORG

Field Summary
private static int BUFF_SIZE
          The byte size of the buffer used to read the datagram packets sent/received by the JxtaMulticastSocket.
private  JxtaReliableMcastChannel channel
          This field holds the channel object that our node is connected to [if the code is extended to support the ability of joining to multiple channels then a Data Structure is going to be needed]
private  java.lang.Object channel_responses_lock
          This object is used to lock the main thrad so that the thread of the RMS will have the time to receive some responses to the query that we sent for joining.
private static org.apache.log4j.Logger LOG
          The Logger object for messages.
private  net.jxta.socket.JxtaMulticastSocket mcastSocket
          The private JxtaMulticastSocket that the RMS is listening to for the formation of the multicast tree [listening for join requests - queries].
private  boolean periodical_req
          True if we are an island node [failed to get a response for a channel in RESP_TIMEOUT seconds] and we periodically send channel join requests [queries] till we receive a response.
private  net.jxta.peergroup.PeerGroup pgrp
          The PeerGroup of the node that RMS is running on.
private  net.jxta.protocol.PipeAdvertisement pipeAdv
          The advertisement of the private JxtaMulticastSocket that the RMS is listening to for the formation of the multicast tree.
private static int RESP_TIMEOUT
          The amount of time that the main thread will wait for responses, before it characterizes the node as an Island.
private  java.lang.Thread rms_Thread
          The indepedent thread of RMS that starts running after start_service() is called.
private  boolean service_is_joined
          Holds the status of the RMS -- joined/not joined to a channel
private  boolean service_is_up
          Holds the status of the RMS -- up/down
private  java.util.TimerTask task
          The task that is going to be performed every time the timer event occurs.
private  java.util.Timer timer
          The Timer object used for the periodical requets for an Island

start_service

public void start_service()
                   throws RMSException
It is called from outside (external class) to start running the JxtaReliableMcastService object that we previously have created. It starts a new thread that will run till the service is stopped.

Throws:
RMSException

stop_service

public void stop_service()
                  throws RMSException
It is called from outside (external class) to stop running the JxtaReliableMcastService object that we previously have created. It stops the thread of RMS and closes the mcastSocket.

Throws:
RMSException

run

public void run()
This is the method that implements the Runnable interface and should be only called from inside the JxtaReliableMcastService [through start_service() and rms_Thread.start()] and never from outside even though run() is public. [interface Runnable is responsible for the publicity]

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

JxtaReliableMcastChannel
Throws:
RMSException

joinChannel

public JxtaReliableMcastChannel joinChannel(java.lang.String channelID,
                                            JxtaReliableEventListener listener)
                                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                            RMSException
It is called from outside (external class) to join a pre existing channel and start listening the data (messages) that the root of the channel is sending. Inside this function we send a query message to express our interest to get joined to the channel and we wait for a small amount of time to collect any possible responses from parent (or even root) nodes. Then we randomly select one of them and we start listening them. If we don't receive any replies then we are an Island and we send periodically query messages till we get a repond.

Parameters:
channelID - String The id of the cannel of our interest
listener - JxtaReliableEventListener The listener that the channel will use to send the events
Returns:
JxtaReliableMcastChannel
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
RMSException

send_multicast_query_for_channel

private void send_multicast_query_for_channel(java.lang.String channel_id)
This function sends a query message through the private mcastSocket to the listening providers & root.

Parameters:
channel_id - String

send_unicast_response_for_channel

private void send_unicast_response_for_channel(java.lang.String dest_name,
                                               java.lang.String dest_id,
                                               java.lang.String channel_id,
                                               java.net.InetAddress reply_addr)
A provider uses this function to respond after receiving an incoming QueryMessage but it uses the unicast send mode of JxtaMulticastSocket to send the respond only to the one who is interested [the sender of the query].

Parameters:
dest_name - String The name of the node that sent us the query message
dest_id - String The ID of the node that sent us the query message
channel_id - String The id of channel of the interest.
reply_addr - InetAddress The address of the receiver.

process_message

private void process_message(net.jxta.endpoint.Message msg,
                             java.net.InetAddress reply_addr)
                      throws RMSException
Process_message is called only if both "service_is_up" and "service_is_joined" are true. It retrieves the elements of the received message. It can be called either from a provider [type of received message is MSG_JOIN_REQ] or from a single node that waits for query message responds [type of received message is SERV_PIPE_ID].

Parameters:
msg - MessageIs the received message by the mcastSocket that heve to be processed
reply_addr - InetAddress The address of the sender of the message [is useful if we later need to unicast a reply to him].
Throws:
RMSException

Message2Datagram

private java.net.DatagramPacket Message2Datagram(net.jxta.endpoint.Message msg)
It converts the Message to a DatagramPacket so that it can be sent through the JxtaMulticastSocket.

Parameters:
msg - Message The message that we have to convert.
Returns:
DatagramPacket

Datagram2Message

private net.jxta.endpoint.Message Datagram2Message(java.net.DatagramPacket pck)

Parameters:
pck - DatagramPacket
Returns:
Message

start_periodical_requests

private void start_periodical_requests()
It is called when we receive no responses to our QueryMessage in RESP_TIMEOUT and so we are Island. It starts to send periodically new QueryMessages till we get an answer from another provider and we get attached under him.

stop_periodical

private void stop_periodical()
Is called whenever we have to stop sending periodically QueryMessages, usually after we receive a response from a provider.
